learning_goal: Business Chinese for pitching a startup to Chinese investors

weeks.theme: Fundamentals of Business Chinese & Startup Introduction

activities.description: Learn essential business vocabulary related to startups, investment, finance, and presentation. Use AI tools for personalized flashcards and vocabulary quizzes.
Focus on sentence structures used in formal business settings.  Learn how to express ideas clearly and concisely.
Listen to audio clips of business presentations, interviews, and investor pitches in Chinese.  Use AI tools for personalized pronunciation practice and feedback.
Create a simple outline for your startup pitch in English.  Translate key phrases into Chinese.
Expand vocabulary related to investment terms, financial concepts, and company valuation.  Use AI-powered vocabulary building tools.
Learn how to express complex ideas and opinions related to investment opportunities.  Develop your ability to use conditional sentences and future tense.
Practice role-playing scenarios involving a startup pitch and investor Q&A sessions.  Use AI-powered speech recognition for feedback.
Revise the English outline of your pitch, focusing on translating key points into concise Chinese sentences.  Use an AI translation tool for suggestions.
Learn about cultural norms in Chinese business interactions and how they may differ from your own cultural background.  Use AI-powered cultural guides for support.
Learn negotiation strategies commonly used in Chinese business contexts.  Practice using these strategies through role-playing exercises.
Read articles about Chinese investment trends and successful startups.  Use AI-powered translation tools to analyze and understand the content.
Refine the translated pitch presentation and incorporate effective negotiation strategies. Practice your delivery with a Mandarin speaker, using an AI-powered language partner for feedback.
Review all learned vocabulary, grammar, and cultural insights.  Use AI-powered quizzes to reinforce knowledge.
Rehearse your Chinese startup pitch in front of a simulated audience (e.g., language exchange partner) and seek feedback.
Practice potential Q&A scenarios with simulated investors, focusing on your responses in Chinese.
Polish your presentation and prepare backup materials for the actual investor meeting. Rehearse your delivery in Mandarin.
